column4: If you have internet access on your Ubuntu computer, you can generate a download script then download from Windows
thats exactly the problem, i need the wifi card for internet
Maybe you could ask here on how to make your wifi card work
I have a guide i am trying to follow, but i need to install some packages, which i currently dont have
you may post here the package and I'll try to give you the depends and the URL's here in mine
yes, but I could only give you the URL's that you could download
it's a shell script
http://pastebin.com/tr9BYDGw I have dkms installed, not sure in the dependencies
ok, ya i need like ALL the depends, so thats not going to work
I used "generate download package script" in synaptic
ya, but you probably have gcc and libc6 and stuff installed
dkms have make, build-essential, dpkg-dev, gcc, and module-init-tools
You may also ask someone here who don't have dkms installed, you might be able to get all dependencies
To use Synaptic's Generate Package Download Script, you need internet for the Ubuntu machine to update the list of packages
You need to update atleast once
i shouldnt need net, just a current apt cache
You may ask someone here that don't have dkms installed, especially those who have newly installed Ubuntu
i have not tried that, but ill see whats up with it
Or you can trace it yourself, that's quite hard
Thanks so much man, this is EXACTLY what i need to do
You're able to solve your problem?
following the guide you linked this will solve it
do you have these installed? module-init-tools, gcc, build-essential, dpkg-dev, patch? They are dkms's dependencies
This might help you: http://keryxproject.org/
